definitions: person who legally owns or has possession of property, goods, or assets
individual who holds, controls, or has custody of something
examples: The possessor of this antique vase inherited it from grandmother
Legal disputes arose between the rightful possessor and the claimant
She became the possessor of rare manuscripts after the auction
The possessor of the winning ticket claimed their prize immediately

definitions: abstract concept representing the likelihood or potential that something might happen or exist in the future
specific choice, alternative, or course of action that could be considered or pursued
theoretical or hypothetical scenario that could potentially become reality under certain conditions
examples: The possibility of rain tomorrow influenced their outdoor wedding plans
Scientists explored the possibility of life existing on distant planets
Moving to Japan represents an exciting possibility for her career advancement
They discussed every possibility before making their final investment decision
The possibility of time travel remains purely theoretical in current physics
He considered the remote possibility that his theory might be wrong

definitions: something that can realistically be accomplished, achieved, or made to happen given current circumstances
person who might be selected, chosen, or considered suitable for a particular role or position
examples: Completing the project by Friday seems like a difficult but possible goal
Finding a cure for this disease remains within the realm of the possible
The committee interviewed five possibles for the management position today
Among the possibles for the scholarship, she had the highest grades

definitions: small to medium-sized nocturnal marsupial with a prehensile tail, found primarily in Australia and the Americas
behavioral tactic of feigning death or unconsciousness when threatened, derived from opossum behavior patterns
examples: The possum climbed expertly through the eucalyptus branches using its strong tail
Australian possums are quite different from their American opossum cousins
When confronted by the aggressive dog, he decided to play possum until help arrived
The child learned to play possum whenever her siblings started arguing loudly

definitions: system of collecting, transporting, and delivering letters, packages, and other mail items to recipients
upright structural support made of wood, metal, or other materials, typically cylindrical or rectangular in cross-section
employment role or professional position with specific duties, responsibilities, and often hierarchical status within an organization
digital message, content, or update shared on social media platforms, blogs, or online forums
specific location, duty station, or assignment where military personnel are stationed or deployed for service
examples: The post arrives every morning at nine o'clock sharp in their neighborhood
She sent the important documents through registered post for security reasons
Workers installed a new wooden post to support the garden fence properly
The old lamp post on the corner has been there for decades
He applied for the post of marketing director at three different companies
The academic post requires extensive research experience and published papers
Her latest post about sustainable living received hundreds of enthusiastic comments
The company's social media post went viral within just a few hours
His military post stationed him in Germany for the next two years
The remote border post required soldiers to remain vigilant at all times

definitions: fee or charge required to send letters, packages, or other items through the postal system, typically represented by stamps
examples: The postage for international letters has increased significantly this year due to rising costs
She calculated the exact postage needed before mailing the heavy package overseas

definitions: small rectangular card typically featuring an image on one side and space for a message and address on the other, designed for mailing without an envelope
examples: She sent colorful postcards from every city during her European vacation to friends
The vintage postcard collection featured beautiful scenes from the early twentieth century

definitions: alphanumeric code used in postal addressing systems to identify specific geographic areas for efficient mail sorting and delivery
examples: Please include the correct postcode when filling out the delivery address form completely
The postcode system helps postal workers sort mail efficiently across different neighborhoods

definitions: temporary research position typically lasting one to three years, undertaken by recent doctoral graduates to gain additional research experience and skills before pursuing permanent academic or industry positions
examples: She secured a prestigious postdoc at Harvard to continue her cancer research
The biology department offers several postdoc opportunities for promising young researchers

definitions: academic or research position undertaken after completing a doctoral degree, involving advanced research work, publication activities, and preparation for independent academic or professional careers
examples: His postdoctoral research focused on developing innovative treatments for neurological disorders
The postdoctoral fellowship provided excellent training in advanced laboratory techniques and methods

definitions: large printed sheet designed for public display, typically featuring images, text, or graphics to advertise events, products, or convey information
academic or professional presentation format consisting of visual displays containing research findings, data, and conclusions arranged on boards or digital screens
individual who creates and shares content, messages, or updates on online platforms, forums, or social media sites
examples: The colorful movie poster outside the cinema attracted many curious passersby
Campaign posters covered every available wall space during the election period
Her research poster at the conference clearly explained the experimental methodology and significant results
The scientific poster session allowed researchers to discuss their work directly with colleagues
The frequent poster shared daily updates about local environmental issues and solutions
Moderators monitored anonymous posters to ensure they followed community guidelines properly

definitions: anatomical term referring to the back part or rear surface of the human body or any organism in medical and biological contexts
something that comes later in time, sequence, or position relative to another element or reference point
examples: The posterior muscles of the leg require specific exercises to strengthen them effectively
X-rays revealed damage to the posterior section of the patient's spinal column
The posterior chapters of the book contained the most important theoretical discussions and conclusions
Posterior analysis revealed patterns that were not apparent in the initial data examination

definitions: all future generations of people who will come after the current time period, often invoked when considering long-term consequences, legacy, or historical preservation
examples: They planted oak trees for posterity, knowing future generations would enjoy their shade
The museum preserves these artifacts for posterity so children can learn about history

definitions: student who has completed an undergraduate degree and is pursuing advanced studies such as master's or doctoral degrees
educational level that follows completion of a bachelor's degree, encompassing various advanced academic programs and research opportunities
examples: The postgraduate struggled to balance her research project with part-time teaching responsibilities
Postgraduate admissions require strong academic records and relevant research experience or professional background
Postgraduate education demands much more independent thinking and original research than undergraduate courses
The university expanded its postgraduate offerings to include several new interdisciplinary programs

definitions: professional assignment or transfer to a new location, position, or duty station, especially common in military, diplomatic, and corporate contexts
act of sharing or publishing content, messages, or updates on digital platforms such as social media, blogs, or online forums
process of sending letters, packages, or other items through the postal system to designated recipients at various locations
examples: His overseas posting to the embassy in Tokyo lasted three challenging but rewarding years
The military posting required the family to relocate to a base in another state
She spent hours each day posting engaging content to grow her business's social media presence
The forum rules prohibit posting personal information or inappropriate content in any discussions
The posting of Christmas cards begins early December to ensure timely delivery worldwide
Efficient posting procedures help the postal service handle increased holiday mail volumes successfully

definitions: postal worker whose primary responsibility involves collecting, sorting, and delivering letters, packages, and other mail items to homes and businesses along designated routes
examples: The friendly postman always greeted neighbors warmly during his daily mail delivery rounds
Children eagerly waited for the postman to arrive with their birthday cards and packages

definitions: official stamp or marking applied by postal services to mail items, indicating the date, time, and location of processing while also canceling stamps to prevent reuse
examples: The postmark showed the letter was sent from London three days ago
Collectors value envelopes with clear, readable postmarks from historic or significant dates

definitions: senior administrative official responsible for managing operations, staff, and services at a local post office or postal facility within a specific geographic area
examples: The postmaster organized community meetings to discuss proposed changes to local postal services
After thirty years of service, the respected postmaster retired with recognition from grateful community members

definitions: late twentieth-century cultural and intellectual movement characterized by skepticism toward grand narratives, embrace of pluralism, and questioning of absolute truths in art, literature, and philosophy
philosophical approach that challenges traditional concepts of objective reality, universal values, and linear progress, emphasizing instead fragmentation, irony, and cultural relativism
examples: Postmodernism influenced architecture through the rejection of modernist principles and embrace of eclectic styles
Art critics debated whether postmodernism represented genuine innovation or merely fashionable intellectual rebellion against established traditions
The philosopher's work exemplified postmodernism through its deconstruction of traditional Western metaphysical assumptions about knowledge and truth
Postmodernism in literature often features unreliable narrators, fragmented narratives, and explicit questioning of storytelling conventions themselves

definitions: medical examination of a deceased person's body to determine the cause, manner, and circumstances of death, performed by qualified pathologists
detailed analysis or review conducted after the completion or failure of a project, event, or situation to identify lessons learned and improvements
examples: The postmortem revealed that the victim died from natural causes rather than foul play
Forensic specialists conducted a thorough postmortem to gather evidence for the criminal investigation
The team's postmortem identified several communication failures that contributed to the project's disappointing results
After the product launch failed, management scheduled a comprehensive postmortem to understand what went wrong

definitions: act of rescheduling or deferring a planned event, activity, meeting, or decision to a later date or time due to various circumstances or considerations
examples: The wedding postponement disappointed many guests who had already made travel arrangements
Due to severe weather conditions, school officials announced the postponement of outdoor graduation ceremonies

definitions: additional message or note added to a letter after the main content has been completed, typically marked with 'P.S.' and containing afterthoughts or supplementary information
supplementary information, comment, or clarification added to any written work, document, or communication after the main text has been finalized
examples: She added a postscript to her letter mentioning the surprise party plans
The postscript contained important details that had been forgotten in the original message
The book's postscript provided updated information about recent developments in the field
His email postscript clarified several points that might have caused confusion among recipients

definitions: fundamental assumption or principle that is accepted as true without proof and serves as the foundation for logical reasoning or theoretical development
basic mathematical statement or principle that is assumed to be true and forms the foundation for geometric proofs and mathematical reasoning systems
examples: The philosopher's central postulate was that human beings naturally seek meaning and purpose in life
Darwin's theory rested on the postulate that natural selection drives evolutionary change over time
Euclid's fifth postulate about parallel lines remained controversial among mathematicians for centuries
The geometry textbook explained each postulate clearly before introducing complex proofs and theorems

definitions: way a person holds their body while standing, sitting, or moving, including the alignment of the spine, shoulders, and other anatomical structures
particular attitude, approach, or stance adopted toward a situation, issue, or relationship, often reflecting underlying beliefs or strategic considerations
examples: Poor posture from hours of computer work caused persistent back and neck pain
The yoga instructor emphasized the importance of maintaining proper posture during each pose
The company adopted an aggressive posture toward its competitors in the marketplace
His diplomatic posture suggested willingness to negotiate despite initial disagreements and tensions

definitions: artificial or exaggerated behavior intended to impress others, gain advantage, or project a particular image rather than reflecting genuine feelings or intentions
deliberate positioning or arrangement of the body, especially for artistic, therapeutic, or demonstrative purposes in various professional or creative contexts
examples: His constant posturing about his achievements made colleagues uncomfortable during office meetings
Political posturing often replaces genuine debate during election campaigns and media appearances
The dance teacher corrected students' posturing to achieve the proper classical ballet positions
Physical therapy included posturing exercises to strengthen core muscles and improve spinal alignment

definitions: round cooking vessel typically made of metal, ceramic, or other heat-resistant materials, used for boiling, stewing, or preparing various foods
container made of clay, ceramic, or other materials, often used for holding plants, storing items, or decorative purposes in homes and gardens
informal slang term referring to marijuana or cannabis, commonly used in casual conversation about recreational drug use
total amount of money wagered or contributed by players in gambling games, particularly poker and other card games
examples: She stirred the soup in the large steel pot on the kitchen stove
The pot of rice boiled over because the heat was set too high
The ceramic pot contained beautiful flowering plants that brightened the garden patio
Ancient pottery included large storage pots used for grain and other food supplies
They smoked pot behind the garage when their parents weren't home
The smell of pot lingered in the apartment long after the party ended
The poker pot reached five hundred dollars before anyone decided to fold
He won the entire pot with a royal flush on the final hand

definitions: water or other liquid that is safe and suitable for human consumption, meeting health standards and quality requirements for drinking purposes
examples: The camping guide emphasized finding sources of potable water before setting up camp
Emergency services distributed potable water to residents after the contamination incident affected local supplies

definitions: essential chemical element with symbol K, crucial for human health and biological functions, commonly found in fruits, vegetables, and used in various industrial applications
examples: Bananas are rich in potassium, making them excellent for preventing muscle cramps during exercise
The doctor recommended increasing potassium intake to help regulate blood pressure and heart function

definitions: starchy edible tuber of the Solanum tuberosum plant, widely cultivated and consumed as a staple food worldwide in various prepared forms
examples: She baked potatoes in the oven and served them with butter and sour cream
The farmer harvested thousands of potatoes from his fertile fields this autumn season

definitions: degree of strength, effectiveness, or concentration of a substance, medicine, or agent in producing its intended biological or chemical effects
male sexual capability and performance, particularly the ability to achieve and maintain erection and engage in sexual intercourse successfully
examples: The laboratory tested the potency of different antibiotic medications to determine proper dosage levels
High potency vitamins require careful dosing to avoid potential adverse health effects from overconsumption
Age-related changes can affect male potency, leading some men to seek medical consultation and treatment
Traditional herbal remedies have long been marketed for enhancing potency, though scientific evidence varies significantly

definitions: inherent ability, capacity, or possibility that exists but has not yet been fully developed, realized, or expressed in actual performance or achievement
electrical property representing the difference in electric charge between two points in a circuit or field, measured in volts
examples: The young athlete showed tremendous potential but needed consistent training to reach professional levels
Despite his potential for leadership, he struggled with confidence and public speaking skills initially
The electrician measured the electrical potential across various components to diagnose the circuit problem effectively
Solar panels convert light energy into electrical potential that can power homes and businesses efficiently

definitions: depression or hole in a road surface caused by wear, weather damage, or poor maintenance, creating hazards for vehicles and potentially causing tire or suspension damage
examples: The deep pothole caused significant damage to several car tires during morning rush hour
City workers filled dozens of potholes throughout the neighborhood after the harsh winter weather

definitions: magical or mystical liquid believed to possess supernatural powers, often featured in fantasy literature, folklore, and fairy tales as having transformative effects
liquid preparation containing herbs, medicines, or other substances intended to treat illness, provide health benefits, or produce specific physiological effects
examples: The witch brewed a love potion using rare herbs gathered under the full moon
Fantasy novels often feature heroes seeking magical potions to restore health or gain special abilities
The herbalist prepared a healing potion from traditional plants known for their medicinal properties
Ancient cultures developed various potions from natural ingredients to treat common ailments and restore vitality

definitions: skilled artisan who creates pottery, vessels, and ceramic objects by shaping clay on a wheel or by hand and firing them in kilns
examples: The potter demonstrated her technique for centering clay on the spinning wheel during the art class
Local potters displayed their handmade bowls, vases, and decorative pieces at the weekend craft fair

definitions: ceramic objects such as pots, bowls, vases, and other vessels made from clay and hardened by firing in kilns
art and craft of making ceramic objects by shaping clay and firing it at high temperatures to create durable and functional items
examples: The museum's pottery collection included beautiful examples from ancient civilizations throughout world history
She inherited her grandmother's pottery, including delicate teacups and decorative serving dishes
Learning pottery requires patience, practice, and understanding of clay properties and firing techniques
The community center offers pottery classes for beginners interested in exploring this ancient creative art form

definitions: small toilet designed specifically for young children who are learning toilet training and transitioning from diapers to regular bathroom use
informal term describing someone as slightly eccentric, silly, or mildly crazy in an endearing or harmless way
examples: The toddler refused to use the potty, preferring to continue wearing diapers for now
Parents often decorate the bathroom with colorful potty training charts to encourage their children's progress
My eccentric neighbor is a bit potty but completely harmless and always friendly
She's quite potty about her garden, talking to plants and giving them individual names

definitions: small flexible bag or container, typically made of fabric, leather, or similar materials, used for carrying or storing small items
natural anatomical structure in certain animals, particularly marsupials, used for carrying and protecting developing offspring or storing food
examples: She kept her coins and keys in a small leather pouch attached to her belt
The tobacco pouch contained enough loose tobacco for rolling several cigarettes throughout the day
The kangaroo carried her joey safely in her pouch while hopping across the Australian outback
Pelicans use their expandable throat pouch to catch and temporarily store fish before swallowing them

definitions: domesticated birds raised for their meat, eggs, or feathers, including chickens, ducks, geese, turkeys, and other commercially farmed bird species
examples: The farmer raised various types of poultry including chickens, ducks, and turkeys for local markets
Poultry products provide important sources of protein and nutrition in diets around the world

definitions: unit of weight measurement equal to approximately 453.6 grams, commonly used in the United States and United Kingdom for measuring various items
basic monetary unit of the United Kingdom and several other countries, symbolized by Â£ and subdivided into smaller denominations
facility where stray, abandoned, or surrendered animals are temporarily housed while awaiting adoption, reclamation by owners, or other disposition
forceful, repeated striking or beating action, typically involving heavy impacts or blows delivered with considerable force and intensity
examples: The recipe called for one pound of flour and two pounds of sugar for the cake
She lost five pounds during her month-long diet and exercise program this summer
The British pound strengthened against the dollar following the economic announcement from London
Converting pounds to euros required checking the current exchange rate before traveling abroad
They adopted a friendly dog from the local animal pound after searching for weeks
The pound was overcrowded with stray cats needing homes and medical care
The construction workers could hear the pound of hammers echoing throughout the building site
Her heart began to pound rapidly after climbing several flights of stairs

definitions: heavy tool or implement designed for pounding, crushing, or breaking materials through repeated forceful impacts, commonly used in construction or food preparation
artillery piece or cannon classified by the weight of the projectile it fires, historically used for military designation of weapon capabilities
examples: The chef used a meat pounder to tenderize the tough cuts of beef
Construction workers employed a pneumatic pounder to break up the old concrete foundation
The antique cannon was a twelve-pounder used during the Revolutionary War
Naval ships were often armed with various pounders ranging from small to massive siege weapons

definitions: continuous or repeated forceful striking, beating, or hammering action that produces loud, rhythmic sounds and impacts
severe physical beating, punishment, or defeat administered through forceful blows or overwhelming force
examples: The pounding of rain on the roof kept everyone awake during the storm
She could feel the pounding of her heart after the intense workout session
The boxer took a severe pounding in the final rounds of the championship fight
The opposing team gave them a real pounding, winning by thirty points

definitions: state of lacking sufficient financial resources to meet basic human needs such as food, shelter, clothing, and healthcare, often characterized by social exclusion and limited opportunities
examples: Many families struggle with poverty despite working multiple jobs to make ends meet
Government programs aim to reduce poverty through education, job training, and social support services

definitions: dry substance consisting of very fine particles produced by grinding, crushing, or pulverizing solid materials into minute fragments
cosmetic product in powdered form applied to the skin for coverage, oil absorption, or decorative purposes in beauty and personal care routines
explosive chemical substance in powdered form used in ammunition, mining, fireworks, or other applications requiring controlled explosive reactions
examples: She mixed the protein powder with milk to make a nutritious post-workout shake
The baker sifted flour powder through a fine mesh to ensure smooth cake batter
The makeup artist applied translucent powder to set the foundation and reduce facial shine
Compact powder is convenient for touch-ups throughout the day during busy schedules
Black powder was the primary explosive used in early firearms and cannons
Mining operations use controlled powder explosions to break rock formations safely and efficiently

definitions: capacity or ability to perform work, exert force, or produce change, often measured in watts or other energy units
authority, influence, or control over others, situations, or resources, often associated with leadership positions or governmental roles
electrical energy generated, transmitted, or consumed by devices, systems, or facilities to operate equipment and provide lighting or heating
mathematical operation involving repeated multiplication of a number by itself a specified number of times, expressed with exponents
examples: The wind turbine generates enough power to supply electricity to hundreds of homes efficiently
Solar panels harness the sun's power to create clean, renewable energy for residential and commercial use
Political power shifted dramatically following the election results and coalition government formation
She wielded considerable power within the organization due to her expertise and leadership abilities
The power went out during the storm, leaving the neighborhood in complete darkness
Electric vehicles require charging stations that can deliver sufficient power for reasonable charging times
Two to the power of three equals eight in basic mathematical calculations
The computer calculated complex power functions for the engineering project's structural analysis requirements

definitions: high-speed motorized boat designed for recreational use, racing, or transportation, typically powered by internal combustion engines and built for performance and maneuverability
examples: The powerboat raced across the lake at impressive speeds during the weekend regatta
They chartered a luxury powerboat for their island-hopping vacation in the Caribbean waters

definitions: person or organization possessing exceptional influence, capability, or dominance in their field, often driving significant change or achievement
facility or plant that generates electrical power, typically housing generators, turbines, and other equipment for energy production and distribution
examples: She became a powerhouse in the technology industry through innovative products and strategic leadership
The small country emerged as an economic powerhouse despite its limited natural resources and geographic constraints
The hydroelectric powerhouse supplies clean energy to thousands of homes throughout the region
Workers maintained the powerhouse equipment to ensure reliable electricity generation during peak demand periods

definitions: viral infection characterized by skin eruptions, fever, and other symptoms, including historical diseases like smallpox and modern conditions like chickenpox
examples: The child stayed home from school with chickenpox until the contagious period ended
Smallpox was eradicated through global vaccination campaigns, representing one of medicine's greatest achievements

definitions: quality of being practical, useful, and suitable for real-world application rather than merely theoretical or decorative, emphasizing functionality and effectiveness over abstract ideals
examples: The car's design balanced aesthetic appeal with practicality for everyday family transportation needs
She valued the practicality of the apartment's layout over its fashionable but impractical design elements

definitions: repeated performance of an activity or skill to achieve improvement, proficiency, or mastery through consistent effort and dedication
professional work or business conducted by licensed practitioners such as doctors, lawyers, or other specialists within their field of expertise
established custom, tradition, or habitual way of doing something within a community, organization, or culture over time
examples: Daily piano practice improved her musical skills significantly over the course of several months
Basketball practice included drills, scrimmages, and conditioning exercises to prepare for upcoming games
The doctor's medical practice specialized in pediatric care for children and adolescents in the community
After law school, she joined a prestigious practice focusing on corporate litigation and business law
The practice of meditation has become increasingly popular for stress reduction and mental wellness
Cultural practices vary significantly between different societies and geographic regions around the world

definitions: person who actively engages in a particular profession, skill, art, or discipline, typically having received formal training and certification in their specialized field
examples: The medical practitioner diagnosed the condition after examining the patient thoroughly and reviewing test results
She became a respected practitioner of traditional Chinese medicine after years of study and apprenticeship
